solution.text:
The percentage of children in the city is 100 - _{k}_ - _{l}_ = _{{100-k-l}}_%
Therefore the number of children in the city is: \( \frac {_{{100-k-l}}_}{100} \times _{{100000*j}}_ \)= _{{(100-k-l)*1000*j}}_

content.text: The population of a city is _{{100000*j}}_. _{k}_% of the population are women and _{l}_% are men. The rest of the population are children. How many children live in the city?
